gurmukhi: ਅਾਵਤ ਹੈ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਭੀਖ ਮਾਗਨਿ ਭਿਖਾਰੀ ਦੀਨ ਦੇਖਤ ਅਧੀਨਹਿ ਨਿਰਾਸੋ ਨ ਬਿਡਾਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Aavat Hai Jaa Kai Bheekh Maagani Bhikhaaree Deena , Daykhat Adheenahi Niraaso N Bidaar Hai ?
translation: Whosoever is visited by a beggar for alms, impressed by his humility, the donor never turns him away disappointed.

gurmukhi: ਬੈਠਤ ਹੈ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਦੁਅਾਰ ਅਾਸਾ ਕੈ ਬਿਡਾਰ ਸ੍ਵਾਨ ਅੰਤ ਕਰੁਨਾ ਕੈ ਤੋਰਿ ਟੂਕਿ ਤਾਹਿ ਡਾਰਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Baitthat Hai Jaa Kai Duaar Aasaa Kai Bidaar Svaana , Ant Karounaa Kai Tori Tooki Taahi Daari Hai ?
translation: Whosoever has a dog coming to his door after discarding all other alternatives, the master of the house out of clemency serves him with a morsel of food.

gurmukhi: ਪਾੲਿਨ ਕੀ ਪਨਹੀ ਰਹਤ ਪਰਹਰੀ ਪਰੀ ਤਾਹੂ ਕਾਹੂ ਕਾਜਿ ੳੁਠਿ ਚਲਤ ਸਮਾਰਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Paain Kee Panahee Rahat Paraharee Paree , Taahoo Kaahoo Kaaji Outthi Chalat Samaari Hai ?
translation: A shoe keeps lying unattended and uncared, but when its owner has to go out on some work, he too takes care of it then and uses it.

gurmukhi: ਛਾਡਿ ਅਹੰਕਾਰ ਛਾਰ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰ ਮਾਰਗ ਮੈ ਕਬਹੂ ਕੈ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਕੈ ਦੲਿਅਾਲ ਪਗਿ ਧਾਰਿ ਹੈ ॥੪੩੪॥
transliteration: Chhaadi Ahankaar Chhaar Hoi Gur Maarag Mai , Kabahoo Kai Daiaa Kai Daiaal Pagi Dhaari Hai ?434?
translation: Similarly, he who ever discards his ego and pride and lives in the refuge of the True Guru in utter humility like the dust of His feet, the clement True Guru will definitely shower His benevolence one day and attach him with His feet (He blesses him with
